name: Rocpool Reserve hotel & Chez Roux

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We originally booked to stay here at the beginning of January but were unable to travel due to illness. We had taken advantage of the winter special offer of 3 nights for the price of 2 and paid one night's deposit in advance. The terms and conditions stated that if cancelled within 1 week of date of stay we were liable for full payment if the room wasn't rebooked by someone else, however, when I called to explain, 2 or 3 days before we were due to arrive, I was immediately told that I could reschedule the booking for when I was well again. They even gave us the same 3 for 2 nights special offer over Valentine's weekend.
reviews.title: Expensive, but worth it for an occasional treat!

reviews.text: There's not much to add to most of the previous reviews for the hotel. The room (room 4) was lovely, very spacious with a huge bathroom, the service was very good and the food in both the restaurant and the bar was excellent. The menu is limited but every choice we made was a good one. Our room was right next to the bar and didn't seem to be terribly well soundproofed but the bar is hardly a rowdy late night venue so it caused no problems.
reviews.title: Chez roux?? No more like Chez poo!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In response to the last reviewer, we also ate in the restaurant the night before Valentine's day and were also offered the steak, pink or well done. I believe this was due to the restaurant being very busy and an effort to try to ease the chef's workload. It certainly wasn't anything to do with age! I did think it a bit odd but my steak came nicely pink in the middle and cooked exactly the way I liked it so I have no complaints! The service we received in the bar was always very good too. The canapes served before dinner were delicious and a nice start to a meal. The breakfasts were fantastic and meant we could happily go without lunch!
reviews.title: Tale of Two Halves

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't receive any of the rushing to open the door and help carry our bags in every time we arrived at the hotel (mentioned in some earlier reviews) but to be honest, that would have made us slightly uncomfortable anyway. Every staff member we came across was well-mannered and friendly. All requests were always met with a smile.
reviews.title: Amazing relaxing hotel with fabulous service and food in a perfect location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, we had a very comfortable stay, in lovely surroundings with very good service and excellent, reasonably priced food and drink. The Rocpool isn't a cheap place to stay and because of that we will not be frequent visitors but we will return for rare treats.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: My wife and I recently stayed here for one night on our honeymoon. As a treat we booked the "extra decadent" room, which we obtained for a very reasonable rate through booking a few months in advance via the hotel's website. The room most definitely lived up to it's billing as "extra decadent"! From literally the moment we arrived, the staff were there to greet us at the door and help us with our bags. The level of service was consistently high throughout our short stay. For example, my wife is allergic to feather pillows and duvets, with which the staff were happy assist by changing the bedding. The staff also brought us tea and coffee on arrival to the hotel. The extra decadent room comes with it's own outdoor hot tub (not overlooked by other rooms, in case you are a bit shy!). This was definitely worth paying for, for that extra touch of luxury! The indoor furnishings also do not disappoint, with a very large, comfy bed, a large flat screen TV and DVD player. One slight issue is that we didn't feel there was much room to dine in the room, but we were happy eating room service with a tray on our laps on the bed! It should be noted that there is space on the balcony for al fresco dining, but it was a bit too cold for this in November. Breakfast can also be delivered to your room at no extra cost, along with a morning paper. The cooked breakfast was superb, not too heavy to eat. The bathroom is also very well equipped with a large bath and monsoon shower. One slight issue is that the bathroom door was glass. I don't want to seem overly prudish, but we found this a bit uncomfortable, especially not sure what we would have done if the hotel staff had knocked on the door while one of us was using the loo! Location wise, the hotel is again superb, being about 5 minutes walk from the centre of Inverness. It is close to a main road, but as our room was round the back of the hotel we didn't hear a thing. Overall, a superb experience that I would recommend to anyone looking for a special treat or something that little more extravagant.
reviews.title: Luxurious hotel ideal for a special break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Rocpool Reserve for two nights in the Fall of 2010. We travel a lot and have stayed in a large number of hotels over the last 12 months, but without a doubt the hotel staff here is the best we have ever seen. They take hospitality to another level.
reviews.title: Truly fantastic service, exceptional staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are large but most of them are lower floors, so we did not have a great view. Some people mentioned that because their room was at the front of the hotel there was a lot of traffic noise, I have to say we slept like babies in our room although ours was at the side of the hotel. We initially had a room at the back (room 6 if I am not mistaking) next to the kitchen which was a bit noisy, but we were immediately offered another room (room 8) when we complained about this. Despite the lack of views, this room was very quiet and although it was nothing exceptional we really enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Flawless, excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also had dinner at Chez Roux, which was very good and not expensive at all. The exceptional service in itself is enough reason for us to come back.
reviews.title: Lovely place, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed one night at this gem, but wished for more as soon as we were showed in. Fabulous place and incredible service and staff. Would recommend this place to anyone wanting to try the absolute best.
reviews.title: Excellent Food, Staff and Service; Room needs Improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very memorable stay and very nearly top notch. Best Breakfast I've had in a hotel in Scotland. Restaurant was a bit of a disappointment - interestingly not that expensive and cetrainly not the most expensive meal I've had in the UK - but a wee bit cramped. Due to the configuration of the three tables for two, my wife seemed closer to the gent on the adjacent table than she was to me. Not helped by constant bickering between the couple at the next table. Situation may never have arisen had the hotel offered both an additional on the house cocktail as they were over 45 minutes late getting into the dining room - I almost bought them a drink myself. Shame that this will be my abiding memory.
reviews.title: Very Nearly Top Notch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a lucky city Inverness is to have a hotel like the RocPool. This really is an exceptional hotel and restaurant and I'm not suprised it has won so many awards. The service was impecable - just the right amount of attentiveness and friendliness - that only a world class hotel knows how to do. Our room was beautifully stylish - with the sort of bathroom you dream of having at home! And our meal was outstanding, the new chef is to be applauded - words can't even begin to describe how sublime the souffle was!
reviews.title: World class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cool, stylish, modern, comfortable are just some of the words that spring to mind. Can't recommend the Rocpool highly enough.
reviews.title: This Is not just a Hotel, this is an Experience in a Haven not to be missed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second time staying at Rocpool Reserve. The first time we stayed was pre - Chez Roux days and the ownership was local as opposed to the current owners in Inverlochy Castle. Our first stay was actually very very good culminating in one of the best breakfasts I have ever eaten being enjoyed in our room. However, the experience now has gone to a new level. The service level is superb without being 'in your face' - it is very subtly provided but you know that should there be any requirement whatsoever, it will be fulfilled, however small or big. I would regard the service level as being an informal butler type arrangement - a member of staff is allocated to look after you to enable you to build up a personal relationship with them and from that you build a rapport. This is overseen by a Manager or should I say Team Leader because make no mistake, this is a team effort as regards service. Our particular Manager / Team Leader was a very pleasant and effective individual who made you comfortable from when first entering the building and you instinctively knew you would be very well looked after. The Suite we stayed in was Room 3, a spacious and well designed living quarters with everything you could ask for provided. Wonderful shower which is what I normally judge a Hotel on (yes, quality of shower!!) and a sumptious bath for my partner to relax in which is her thing. We dined in Chez Roux on our two evenings spent at Rocpool Reserve. I had only ever had lunch there before so I knew roughly what to expect which I should add is outstanding. We were not disappointed. This is French Cuisine incorporating fantastic local produce delivered with flair and imagination. On one evening, I had one of the 'Specials' which was a Tagliatelle based dish with lobster and other assorted seafood. Quite delicious with the Tagliatelle cooked to absolute perfection. What's more, the Head Chef visited our table after our meal to get our feedback on our Dining Experience. A nice and essential exercise as regards continuous improvement. Breakfast was superb with a choice that was so extensive that it made choosing quite difficult but enjoyable at the same time. So, all in all, a wonderful holistic experience and one that makes a return visit compelling when the opportunity presents itself. And no, I've not been paid to write this or have I or will I receive preferential rates in the future!!!!!!! Just an honest appreciation of a quality set up and I like quality.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: Have just returned from 3 days in the Rocpool Reserve. We were very impressed, the service was impeccable - very friendly well trained and polite staff - we got some excellent local tips for places to visit and local beers to try - all of which turned out very well. Staff very attentive which make us feel well looked after, nothing was too much trouble. Room was excellent - very clean, serviced twice a day and kept looking very good and stocked with everything we needed. The restaurant was very good - breakfast of the highest quality and kept us fuelled up for the whole day, it was a very hard choice from the menu for the evening we ate in - everything was well cooked and tasted great - wish we could have eaten a few more nights to try more options of the menu!
reviews.title: Excellent in every way. First class.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We’ve stayed at a lot of hotels in a lot of countries recently and this was by far our favourite, we only realised how much once we checked in to the next one! The service was really incredible. From the moment we drove into the driveway the staff helped with our bags and came out with an umbrella to help us inside when it started raining. They were very attentive and really understood what a guest wants. When we arrived they booked us dinner at their restaurant, which was exactly what we wanted after a long drive. The food was great and it wasn’t overly pricey either.
reviews.title: Perfect honeymoon hotel
Great but attention to detail slipping a bit
reviews.text: The room itself was the perfect size with all the facilities you could need (hairdryer, iron, safe, block out blinds, free bottled water). It was alittle warm but we just used the air conditioner. Also the fridge didn’t really cool so we could not use it for some juice we purchased but I think this is common in the UK.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was huge and incredibly comfortable. There were dimmer lights and lamps for reading, a large tv with plenty of stations and the option to play a selection of DVDs. The bathroom had a large double shower (which I’ve added to the list for my next house) and separate bath, robes and a fan - which seems rare over here. The décor was simple and elegant.
reviews.title: "Through a glass darkly"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was included and you could choose from a wide range of cold or hot foods. We chose to have ours as room service so we could have breakfast in bed and thoroughly enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Pricey but worth it

reviews.text: It was a bit of a splurge for us but definitely worth it. The whole experience was perfect and we wish we could stay here again.
reviews.title: The Best Food and Service in Inverness

aka: Rocpool Reserve Hotel & Chez Roux Hotel Inverness
description: 5 Star boutique hotel opened in February 2006. A totally renovated Georgian Townhouse featuring stunning modern original design. The hotel also has a Chez Roux restaurant with a French flair and R-bar for cocktails. All produce used is local produce.
